Class PongBall

  • java.lang.Object
    • PongBall

  • public class PongBall
extends java.lang.Object
    PongBall which controls all of the ball logic of the pong game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PongBall(PongGame game)
      The PongBall constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void move(PongHuman human, PongComputer computer)
      The move function that determines where the ball will be located the next timer task call and implements all colision logic
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the ball and makes it a radius 7 ball
      void reset()
      Resets the ball to original coordinates, to center and moves ball to human side

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PongBall

        public PongBall(PongGame game)
        The PongBall constructor. Constructs a new ball instance, setting x coordinate and y coordinate to middle of field and ball speed to 3 to the left each timer function call
        Parameters:
        game - PongGame instance to which the ball is referring to when implementing ball behavior logic

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the ball and makes it a radius 7 ball
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics instance g to which the ball color and size are implemented and drawn

      • move

        public void move(PongHuman human,
                 PongComputer computer)
        The move function that determines where the ball will be located the next timer task call and implements all colision logic
        Parameters:
        human - The pong human the ball refers to when checking for colision and "hit bonus"
        computer - The pong computer the ball refers to when checking for colision

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the ball to original coordinates, to center and moves ball to human side
